Title: Issues with camera

Specs:  CPU: Intel(R) Core(TM) i5-10400, RAM: 16 GB, Video: Nvidia GTX 1660 Super, VRAM: 6GB

Severity: Medium

Frequency: High

Description: After a certain amount of play time, generally between 2 and 5 hours, the automatic camera in game stops functioning as intended, defaulting to Orbital. Following that switch, the automatic camera does not move in the same fashion as previously, rotating in unexpected directions on the various mouse axis'. In addition, the camera also assumes a fixed zoom when switching from the Map view back to your craft, usually far enough away from your craft for it to be nearly invisible.

I am not 100% sure this is related to time played, but could also be a result of reaching an unknown threshold of autosave file size or number of craft/parts active. With the current state of the game, I have never had more than 3 individual craft in flight at one time, but my observations make my think that the more complext the craft, the quicker the camera bug occurs. 

Please let me know if you need any additional information.
Ive got the same issue. I find that reverting to launch sometimes fixes it for aircrafts.

I find that after EVA, the camera is always bugged until maybe a full game restart. Might just be until revert, but I haven't checked that far... yet.

Similar issues happen after I've used manual controls for pan, zoom, etc. on the number pad while in capture view.
